channel.title: When you kill a combine
channel.description:
When you kill a combine cop in HL2, there is a female voice message (some sort of warning). Does anyone know what does it say? I cant make it out since its not very clear. Just curious, thx.
Edit: And also, what is the announcement at the start of route canal saying? ("attention protection scheme......." "attention please, an identified person" etc... something about civil protection scheme?)

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Empire95
item.description:
Humanoid Combine
The primary military force of the Combine on Earth is the humanoid Combine Overwatch (referred to by Doctor Breen as the “Transhuman arm of the Combine Overwatch”, although he could be referring to the entire Combine military presence on earth as the Overwatch and the ranks including modified humans are the transhuman arm.): humans who have been modified into “transhuman” (or “post-human”, as referred to by Dr. Kleiner) cyborgs. They are the most frequently encountered foes throughout Half-Life 2. This could also be another possible reason why they are called the Combine, because they are a “combination” of humans and alien technology. It is important to note that the Civil Protection foes are not hybrids and are in fact, human.

Civil Protection: The quasi-thoughtpolice that patrols the cities, monitor the public airways, and conduct randomized raids. Since little modification is involved, some Resistance members, such as Barney Calhoun, join Civil Protection in order to go under cover to investigate Combine activity and tip off would-be victims.
Overwatch Soldier: The main military of the Combine on Earth. Soldiers patrol and enforce Combine law outside of the city boundaries. It includes the Shotgun Soldier and the Nova Prospekt Prison Guard.
Overwatch Elite: The Elite soldiers of the Combine Overwatch. They’ve undergone extensive modifications and are seen protecting the Citadel or occasionally leading squads of regular soldiers.
Stalker: Mutilated, drone-like slaves that are created from dissident Citizens and captured Rebels.

Guys, that mean that I know ^^

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Personally, I feel the Overwatch is more likely to be a heavily modified human rather than a computer. Her voice seems too natural, especially when you compare it to things like GlaDOS. But who knows?

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
coldroll:

I wouldn’t call the elites robots but they are quite close.

baconeggs:

little more than robots.

Dias:

Except for the fact that in Episode 2’s credits file you see; “Ellen McLain - Overwatch”

Yeah but they are two distinct things, he was just trying to show that. Both can be called Overwatch for short.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
I’ve got a mostly complete transcript of all of the soldier & dispatcher dialogue. I’d post it, but it’s gigantic & could still use some work.

Spycrabz:

It’s the Overwatch Dispatcher, Overwatch is the name given to the Transhuman Combine Soldiers collectively.

Except for the fact that in Episode 2’s credits file you see; “Ellen McLain - Overwatch”

Read full topic

item.description:
I wouldn’t call the elites robots but they are quite close.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
The way Combine assimilation works is by reward scheme. People join Civil Protection for better living conditions and power. CP Officers are encouraged to do well by further rewards including “organic reproduction simulation” as said by the Overwatch Dispatch, indicating they get free sex for doing a good job.

However, in order to move up the food chain you have to give away more of your humanity. By agreeing to become part of the Overwatch military you go through the surgical processes and become more of a slave. Overwatch soldiers aren’t rewarded so much as threatened to do their tasks. The Dispatch constantly mentions “permanent off-world assignment” in Nova Prospekt.

Presumeably the Elite Corps seen towards the end of the game have had further modifications to their bodies and may be little more than robots.

Read full topic

item.description:
Police aren’t exactly “military”.

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Apollomasque
item.description:
Where exactly does this information about CPs being human come from? I always assumed ALL Combine were modified in some way or another. Didn’t Isacc say that all those who became a part of the military machine were purged of their humanity?
The only contradiction of this that I’ve seen is the Civil Protection series by Ross Scott, and that’s a parody.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
There’s a colour difference for a reason.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
Mr. Someguy:

I thought it was common knowledge that most CP were 100% human.

I never really thought too heavily into it. You never see any metro cop besides barney take off their mask, and the only time you see any combine without their mask is the one with the white guy in Nova Prospekt.
On top of that I had trouble identifying metrocops from the actual soldiers period, since I usually shot and moved on before actually stopping to get a look at the differences between the costuming. Soldiers were just the ones with the bigger guns as far as I was concerned.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
I thought it was common knowledge that most CP were 100% human.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
Coozins:

Nope, Metrocops are humans who volunteer to “police” City 17 so they can get better food and living conditions etc.

You know, I had wondered about that for a while. I thought everyone who joined the combine had to undergo the transhuman organ removal/replacement procedure. It left me wondering why Barney hadn’t gotten found out for not having undergone that procedure. This makes so much more sense now. It’s also going to make it a lot easier to play Human Error now.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Well, that guy also bashes you with a stun baton if you don’t do what he says.

Anyway, most of them are probably pretty normal, easy going people, but the power went to their heads. If you’ve read about the Stanford Prison Experiment you should know what I mean.

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Yeah, that one guy just makes you throw a can away. The rest will bash you over the head with their stun batons (or worse!).

Read full topic

item.title: When you kill a combine
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
wafflewarrior7:

. The voice they used is similar to glados, only more british, and with a radio effect over it.

That’s because the same person voiced it, Ellen McLain. She also voiced the announcer in TF2 and the Overwatch dispatcher that we’re talking about.

Read full topic
